body:
Nov 7 (Reuters) - Rambus Inc (RMBS.O) said it has signed a memorandum of understanding with Intel Corp (INTC.O) to explore possible uses for its XDR memory technology.

The company, which develops and licenses computer technology, stressed that Intel was only evaluating the technology for possible future uses and has no specific product plans for the XDR memory technology at this time. (Reporting by Jennifer Robin Raj in Bangalore, Editing by Anil D‘Silva)
header: Rambus signs MOU with Intel on memory chip technology

body: Intraday resistance for the index is at 2217 in front of yesterday’s high at 2224. Important to hold above 2210/2208 on an intraday pullback.
header: Nasdaq 100 the top performing index amid relative strength in AAPL +0.2%, RIMM +3.5%, GOOG +0.5%, INTC +0.07%
